definitions: ancient city sacred to Judaism, Christianity, and Islam, located in the Middle East
capital city of Israel and major religious center with deep historical significance
examples: Jerusalem attracts millions of religious pilgrims each year
The old city of Jerusalem contains sites sacred to three major religions
Jerusalem serves as Israel's seat of government and cultural center
Modern Jerusalem has expanded far beyond its ancient walls

definitions: member of the Society of Jesus, a Catholic religious order founded by Ignatius of Loyola
educator or administrator associated with Jesuit schools and universities worldwide
examples: The Jesuit priest devoted his life to missionary work
Jesuits have been influential in Catholic theology for centuries
He studied at a prestigious Jesuit university in Boston
The Jesuit tradition emphasizes rigorous intellectual inquiry

definitions: person who belongs to the Jewish people through religion, ethnicity, or cultural heritage
examples: Many Jews observe the Sabbath from Friday evening to Saturday
Jews have contributed significantly to arts and sciences worldwide

definitions: the Jewish people considered collectively as a community, culture, or ethnic group
examples: European Jewry faced unprecedented persecution during the Holocaust
American Jewry has established thriving communities across the country

definitions: biblical queen of Israel known for promoting idol worship and opposing the prophet Elijah
derogatory term for a woman considered shameless, scheming, or morally corrupt
examples: Jezebel introduced the worship of Baal to the kingdom of Israel
The story of Jezebel appears in the Books of Kings
The novel's villain was portrayed as a modern-day jezebel
Such outdated terms like jezebel reflect historical gender biases

definitions: person who advocates or participates in jihad as armed struggle, often associated with Islamic extremism
examples: Security forces arrested several suspected jihadists planning an attack
The jihadist group claimed responsibility for the bombing

definitions: Japanese Shinto shrine or temple where kami spirits are enshrined and worshipped
examples: Tourists visited the ancient jinja nestled in the mountain forest
The local jinja hosts traditional festivals throughout the year

definitions: traditional assembly of leaders making decisions by consensus in Afghanistan and Pakistan
examples: The village jirga convened to resolve the land dispute
A grand jirga was called to discuss matters of regional importance

definitions: abbreviation for junior, used after a name to distinguish son from father
examples: Robert Smith Jnr inherited his father's business empire
The invitation was addressed to William Brown Jnr

definitions: regular paid position of employment or professional occupation
particular task or piece of work that needs to be done
biblical figure known for patience and suffering in the Book of Job
examples: She started her new job at the marketing firm yesterday
Finding a good job requires networking and persistence
The repair job took longer than expected to complete
Painting the house was a difficult job requiring several days
The story of Job teaches about faith during suffering
Job remained faithful despite losing everything he had

definitions: largest city in South Africa and major economic hub of the African continent
examples: Johannesburg remains the financial capital of South Africa
The gold rush transformed Johannesburg into a major metropolis

definitions: biblical prophet who was swallowed by a great fish after fleeing from God's command
person believed to bring bad luck or misfortune to those around them
examples: Jonah spent three days in the belly of the whale
The Book of Jonah tells of his mission to Nineveh
The sailors considered him a jonah bringing storms to their voyage
Nobody wanted the jonah on their team after consecutive losses

definitions: kingdom in the Middle East bordered by Israel, Syria, Iraq, and Saudi Arabia
river flowing through the Jordan Valley into the Dead Sea
examples: Jordan maintains peaceful relations with its neighboring countries
The ancient city of Petra attracts tourists to Jordan
Jesus was baptized in the Jordan River according to scripture
The Jordan River forms a natural boundary between countries

definitions: citizen or native of the Hashemite Kingdom of Jordan in the Middle East
examples: The Jordanian diplomat addressed the United Nations assembly
Many Jordanians work in the tourism and service industries

definitions: standard unit of energy in the International System equal to one newton-meter
examples: The battery stores approximately one million joules of energy
A joule equals the energy needed to lift an apple one meter

definitions: alternative name for Jupiter, the king of gods in Roman mythology
examples: By Jove, that was an extraordinary performance last night
Ancient Romans made sacrifices to Jove for good fortune

definitions: ancient region in the southern Levant corresponding to the territory of the biblical Kingdom of Judah
examples: Roman forces occupied Judaea after defeating the Jewish revolt
Judaea was the birthplace of Christianity and Judaism

definitions: ancient kingdom in the southern part of Israel with Jerusalem as its capital
fourth son of Jacob and Leah, founder of the Tribe of Judah
examples: The Kingdom of Judah lasted until the Babylonian conquest
Judah separated from Israel after Solomon's death
Judah became the ancestor of King David's royal line
The tribe of Judah settled in the southern territory

definitions: objects, texts, and artifacts related to Jewish religion, culture, history, and traditions
examples: The museum's Judaica collection includes ancient Torah scrolls
She collects Judaica from different periods of Jewish history

definitions: ancient monotheistic religion of the Jewish people based on the Torah and rabbinic teachings
examples: Judaism emphasizes ethical behavior and social justice
Orthodox Judaism maintains strict observance of religious laws

definitions: alternative spelling of Judaea, the ancient region in the southern Levant
examples: Herod the Great ruled Judea under Roman authority
Many biblical events took place in ancient Judea

definitions: overwhelming, advancing force that crushes everything in its path
British term for a large heavy truck or articulated lorry
examples: The tech company became a juggernaut dominating the entire industry
Nothing could stop the political juggernaut of the reform movement
The juggernaut thundered down the motorway carrying heavy machinery
Several juggernauts were stuck in traffic on the M25

definitions: seventh month of the year in the Gregorian calendar, having thirty-one days
examples: Independence Day is celebrated on the fourth of July
July tends to be the hottest month in many northern regions

definitions: sixth month of the year in the Gregorian calendar, having thirty days
examples: Many students graduate from high school in June
June weddings are popular due to pleasant weather conditions

definitions: practitioner or adherent of analytical psychology developed by Carl Jung
examples: The Jungian therapist explored the patient's dreams and archetypes
Jungian analysis focuses on the collective unconscious

definitions: person younger than another or having less experience
person of lower rank or standing in an organization
student in the third year of high school or college
examples: The junior employee learned quickly from senior staff members
As the junior partner, she handled preliminary research tasks
He was promoted from junior to senior analyst last month
Junior officers must complete additional training requirements
The junior class organized the annual prom celebration
She's a junior majoring in biochemistry at the university

definitions: member of the landed aristocracy in Prussia and eastern Germany
old, dilapidated car or vehicle barely functioning
examples: The Junkers held considerable political power in imperial Germany
Bismarck came from a traditional Junker family background
That old junker barely made it up the hill
He bought a junker to fix up in his spare time

definitions: queen of gods in Roman mythology, goddess of marriage and childbirth
NASA space probe launched to study the planet Jupiter
examples: Juno was the wife of Jupiter in Roman mythology
Romans honored Juno as protector of the state
The Juno spacecraft entered Jupiter's orbit in July 2016
NASA's Juno mission revealed new details about Jupiter's storms

definitions: fifth and largest planet from the sun in our solar system
king of the gods in Roman mythology, god of sky and thunder
examples: Jupiter's Great Red Spot is a massive storm system
Jupiter has at least seventy-nine known moons
Ancient Romans built temples to honor Jupiter
Jupiter was equivalent to Zeus in Greek mythology

definitions: geological period from about 201 to 145 million years ago, known for dinosaur dominance
examples: Many famous dinosaur fossils date from the Jurassic period
The Jurassic saw the evolution of the first birds

definitions: quality of being fair and reasonable in treatment or judgment
judge, especially of a supreme court or court of appeals
examples: The protesters demanded justice for victims of police brutality
Justice requires treating all people with equal respect
The Chief Justice presided over the constitutional hearing
Supreme Court justices serve lifetime appointments

definitions: rough fiber from tropical plants used for making rope, sacks, and coarse cloth
examples: Bangladesh is the world's largest producer of jute fiber
The jute sacks were used to transport coffee beans

definitions: main security agency of the Soviet Union from 1954 to 1991, responsible for intelligence and state security
examples: The KGB operated extensive spy networks during the Cold War
Former KGB officers held influential positions after Soviet collapse

definitions: Ku Klux Klan, a white supremacist hate group founded in the United States after the Civil War
examples: The KKK terrorized African Americans during the Reconstruction era
Federal laws were enacted to combat KKK violence and intimidation

definitions: cube-shaped building in Mecca, Saudi Arabia, the most sacred site in Islam toward which Muslims pray
examples: Muslims face the Kaaba during their five daily prayers
Pilgrims circle the Kaaba seven times during the Hajj

definitions: ancient Jewish tradition of mystical interpretation of the Bible and esoteric teachings
examples: Kabbalah explores the hidden meanings within sacred texts
Madonna's interest brought Kabbalah to mainstream attention

definitions: capital and largest city of Afghanistan, located in the eastern part of the country
examples: Kabul has been an important trade center for centuries
International forces withdrew from Kabul after twenty years

definitions: ethnic group inhabiting northern Myanmar and parts of China and India
examples: The Kachin people have their own distinct language and culture
Kachin State is rich in natural resources including jade

definitions: title of the German emperor, especially from 1871 to 1918
examples: Kaiser Wilhelm II ruled Germany during World War I
The Kaiser abdicated following Germany's defeat in 1918

definitions: large semi-arid sandy savanna in southern Africa covering parts of Botswana, Namibia, and South Africa
examples: The Kalahari Desert supports diverse wildlife despite harsh conditions
San people have inhabited the Kalahari for thousands of years

definitions: AK-47 assault rifle or its variants, designed by Mikhail Kalashnikov
examples: The Kalashnikov became the world's most widely used assault rifle
Rebel forces were armed with old Kalashnikov rifles

definitions: Hindu goddess associated with time, change, power, and destruction of evil
examples: Devotees worship Kali as the divine mother and protector
Kali is often depicted with multiple arms and a garland of skulls

definitions: pleasure, desire, and love as one of the four goals of human life in Hinduism
examples: The Kama Sutra explores kama as essential to human experience
Kama represents the aesthetic and sensual aspects of life

definitions: spirits or phenomena worshipped in the Shinto religion of Japan
examples: Each shrine is dedicated to specific kami of the area
Kami can inhabit natural features like mountains and rivers

definitions: Dravidian language spoken predominantly in the Indian state of Karnataka
examples: Kannada has a rich literary tradition spanning over a millennium
Over forty million people speak Kannada as their native language

definitions: largest city and former capital of Pakistan, major port on the Arabian Sea
examples: Karachi is Pakistan's main financial and commercial center
The port of Karachi handles most of Pakistan's maritime trade

definitions: city in Iraq sacred to Shia Muslims, site of the martyrdom of Hussein
examples: Millions of pilgrims visit Karbala during the annual Ashura commemoration
The Battle of Karbala shaped the Sunni-Shia divide in Islam

definitions: member of a Finnic ethnic group native to the Karelia region between Finland and Russia
examples: Karelian culture combines Finnish and Russian influences
The Karelian language is closely related to Finnish

definitions: ethnic group from Myanmar and Thailand with distinct languages and cultures
examples: The Karen people have faced decades of conflict in Myanmar
Karen refugees have resettled in countries around the world

definitions: mountainous region in South Asia disputed between India, Pakistan, and China
examples: Kashmir has been a source of conflict since partition in 1947
The Kashmir valley is renowned for its natural beauty
